metadata.title: CVE-2017-9063 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In WordPress before 4.7.5, a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilityrelated to the Customizer exists, involving an invalid customizationsession.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9063` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wordpress package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.9.5+dfsg1-1').
